intro: Canthium longistylum, commonly known as the longistylum spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its smooth, cylindrical stems and alternate, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium longistylum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open forests.
